message.content:
cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.CL 

This paper discusses an experiment in human-computer interaction, specifically in teaching a computer to play a strategy board game. This topic is closely related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the use of machine learning models (cs.LG) and their limitations in this context. Additionally, the paper mentions similar approaches in robot task learning (cs.RO) and classic approaches to human learning (cs.CL). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI and cs.HC, followed by cs.LG, cs.RO, and cs.CL.
